description: E-commerce shopping cart checkout - ATDD/TDD example
acceptanceCriteria: Given a cart with valid items, when user proceeds to checkout, then order is created with correct totals
Given a cart with items, when payment processing succeeds, then order is confirmed and cart is cleared
Given a cart with items, when payment processing fails, then order is not created, error message is shown, and cart is preserved
Given a cart with out-of-stock items, when user checks out, then out-of-stock items are flagged and checkout is blocked
Given a cart with discount code, when user applies valid code, then discount is applied to total
Given a cart with discount code, when user applies invalid code, then error is shown and no discount applied
Given a completed order, when user views order history, then order appears with correct details and status
notes: Complex business logic with multiple integration points
Demonstrates ATDD for end-to-end business process
TDD will ensure edge cases and error handling
Integration tests critical for payment and inventory verification
